decks.notes: The deck revolves around utilizing Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to control the game through a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures. The deck includes a wide range of control elements such as spell snare, spell pierce, remand, and mystic confluence to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect Geist. It also features efficient removal options like swords to plowshares and detention sphere. The deck aims to out-value opponents by generating card advantage with cards like ancestral vision and snapcaster mage. Additionally, the deck includes powerful win conditions in the form of cards like Elspeth, Knight-Errant, True-Name Nemesis, and sword of feast and famine to finish off opponents.

This combo-focused deck revolves around using Sidisi, Undead Vizier as the commander to tutor for key cards that enable strong graveyard interactions and combos. The deck includes various discard spells to disrupt opponents' hands, along with powerful removal spells like Damnation and Hero's Downfall to control the board. The main win condition involves reanimating big threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Griselbrand, supported by cards like Necromancy and Animate Dead. To facilitate the combo, the deck includes mana acceleration like Dark Ritual and mana rocks, along with graveyard manipulation spells like Buried Alive and Corpse Dance. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and disruption while setting up game-winning combos.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays using the commander Marath, Will of the Wild, as well as other powerful creatures and supportive spells. By leveraging mana acceleration from cards like Llanowar Elves and Birds of Paradise, the deck aims to quickly ramp up and establish board presence. The inclusion of cards like Gaddock Teeg and Aven Mindcensor helps disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker provide additional threats and combo potential. The deck also features strong utility cards like Swords to Plowshares and Sylvan Library to maintain control and card advantage. Overall, the deck seeks to press the advantage early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on using the Commander, Marath, Will of the Wild, to create a constant stream of tokens and generate value through its abilities. The key strategy is to ramp up quickly with mana dorks and mana-producing lands, allowing for early Marath activations. The deck also includes powerful utility creatures that can be searched for and utilized with cards like Birthing Pod and Green Sun's Zenith. Additionally, there are various combos and synergies within the deck that allow for explosive turns and overwhelming board presence. Overall, the goal is to pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures while maintaining a versatile and adaptive gameplay style to outmaneuver and outvalue the opponent in a 1 vs 1 duel.

The deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing Anafenza, the Foremost as the commander. It includes a variety of creatures and spells that disrupt the opponent's game plan while building a strong board presence. The deck includes mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Elvish Mystic to ramp up quickly and play threats ahead of curve. It also includes powerful disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Swords to Plowshares to control the opponent's resources. Additionally, it has powerful finishers like Elspeth, Knight-Errant and Sword of Feast and Famine to close out games quickly. The key strategy is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and maintain a strong board presence to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to efficiently generate mana and play creatures that benefit from Animar's ability to reduce their casting cost. By using cards like Dorks (Llanowar Elves, Fyndhorn Elves, Birds of Paradise, etc.), mana rocks (Chrome Mox, Mana Confluence, etc.), and enchantments (Utopia Sprawl, Wild Growth), the deck aims to quickly ramp up its resources to play powerful threats such as Eldrazi titans like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Kozilek, Butcher of Truth. Additionally, the deck includes combo pieces like Aluren and Cloudstone Curio to chain creatures and generate value. Overall, the goal is to assemble a board state that overwhelms the opponent and secures a victory through aggressive creature plays and combo interactions.

The primary focus of this deck is to utilize the graveyard and sacrifice synergies in order to assemble powerful combos and control the game. Karador, Ghost Chieftain serves as the commander, allowing for creatures to be easily reanimated from the graveyard. With a mix of creatures that can be sacrificed for value, such as Viscera Seer and Carrion Feeder, alongside powerful utility creatures like Eternal Witness and Thrun, the Last Troll, the deck aims to generate value and disrupt opponents' strategies. Cards like Birthing Pod and Recurring Nightmare further enable the deck to assemble key pieces quickly and efficiently, while removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Swords to Plowshares help control the board and protect the combo.

The deck focuses on using Marath, Will of the Wild's abilities to create a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and powerful spells. It includes various ramp and mana fixing cards to ensure a smooth mana curve, as well as utility creatures and spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes a toolbox of creature tutors to fetch key creatures when needed, as well as card advantage engines like Skullclamp and Sylvan Library to keep the card flow going. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, utilizing Marath's versatile abilities to pressure the opponent and secure victories through efficient resource management and strategic gameplay.
